docs.summary: The Contacts API is used to manage a site's contacts.
description: When a visitor first interacts with your site in a number of ways —
such as submitting a contact form or subscribing to a newsletter —
Once that happens, their details are available through the Contacts API.
Here are some examples for how a visitor could be converted to a contact:
- The visitor fills in a form with their contact details
- The visitor signs up as a site member
Basic contact information is stored in the default properties.
This includes information such as contact name, company, phone numbers, addresses, and  email addresses.
Additional properties are stored in extended fields.
There are 2 types of extended fields:
- **System fields** are added by Wix apps.
They often enrich your contacts with data from Wix products, such as Wix Bookings or Wix Stores.
When viewing system field settings, `fieldType` is `"SYSTEM"`.
- **Custom fields** can be added by site contributors or 3rd-party apps.
Custom fields can be renamed, and their data can be written by site contributors and 3rd-party apps.
When viewing custom field settings, `fieldType` is `"USER_DEFINED"`.
When you create, update, or retrieve contacts,
you'll find extended field data under `info.extendedFields`.
Most system fields are read-only, while all custom fields can be written to.
You can also manage your site's extended fields with these functions:
#### `namespace` and `key` Properties in Labels and Extended Fields
When a label or an extended field is created,
it's assigned a `namespace` and a unique `key`.
Labels and extended fields created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps are part of the `custom` namespace.
Anything in the `custom` namespace can be updated or deleted by site contributors and 3rd-party apps.

params.name: contactInfo
params.doc:
Contact's information.
To reconcile with an existing contact,
a phone or email must be provided,
or the current session identity must be attached to a contact or member.

If no existing contact can be found,
a new contact is created with the specified information.

<!--ONLY:REST
Required if there's no contextual identity or given `contactId`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

docs.summary: Appends an existing contact or creates a contact if it doesn't exist.
description: that resolves to a contact ID and identity type when a contact is found or created.
When called, `appendOrCreateContact()` accepts an object with contact information and follows the steps below.
When one of the conditions is met, this process ends and the specified
1. **If the current visitor is a logged-in member:** `appendOrCreateContact()` reconciles with the member's associated contact.
2. **If the visitor is not a logged-in member:** `appendOrCreateContact()` tries to reconcile any specified email addresses and/or phone numbers with an existing contact.
3. **If no contact can be reconciled in the previous steps:** `appendOrCreateContact()` tries to reconcile the visitor's session identity with an existing contact.
4. **If no contact can be reconciled and an email address, phone number, or name are provided:** A new contact is created and `appendOrCreateContact()` reconciles with the new contact.
5. **If no contact can be created:** The Promise is rejected.
so it does not return the entire contact object.
The contact's data can be retrieved with
- The current visitor's session identity is associated with the contact, if it isn't already.
- If a specified property is empty in the existing contact, the property is updated with the specified information.
- For arrays, any specified information is added as new array items. This includes `emails`, `addresses`, `phones`, and `labelKeys`.
- No existing data is overwritten or deleted.
- The new contact's data is populated with the specified contact object.
- The current visitor's session identity is associated with the contact.

Append or create a contact, full object

description: The request body must include a name, a phone number, or an email address.
If all 3 of these parameters are missing,
if the creation request contains an email already in use by another contact,
the new contact won't be created.
To override this behavior, set `allowDuplicates` to `true`.
that resolves to the new contact when it is created.

The `contactInfo` parameter object must include a name, phone number, or email address.
If all 3 of these parameters are missing,
if the call contains an email already in use by another contact,
the new contact won't be created.

docs.summary: Deletes a contact who is not a site member or contributor.
description: Deleting a contact permanently removes them from the Contact List.
that resolves when the specified contact is deleted.
> The deprecated function will continue to work, but it will not receive updates.

Deleting a contact permanently removes them from your Contact List.
If the contact is also a site member,
the member must be deleted first,
and then the contact can be deleted.
The `deleteExtendedField()` function returns a Promise that resolves
when the specified extended field is deleted.
When an extended field is deleted,
any contact data stored in the field is permanently deleted as well.

docs.summary: Retrieves a label with a given name, or creates one if it doesn't exist.
description: Successful calls to this endpoint always return a label,
which can be passed to subsequent requests.
For example, in the Contacts API,
requests will fail if you include a nonexistant label.
To ensure successful calls, you can call this endpoint first,
and then use the response in the label and unlabel requests.
To find an existing label without potentially creating a new one, use
that resolves when the specified label is found or created.

which can be passed to subsequent function calls.

examples.title: Get a contact's latest revision number, then update
body: // Get the contact's last revision number

extra.description:
The page code passes a contact ID and updated contact information
to the backend `overwriteContactInfo()` function.
`overwriteContactInfo()` then retrieves the contact,
extracts the revision number, and passes it to `contacts.updateContact()`.
This ensures that the contact is always updated
without needing to specify the revision.

This can be used when it's not important that some contact information could be overwritten.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Extended field key.

<!--ONLY:REST
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.notes",
the value can be accessed at `extendedfields["custom.notes"]`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

description: that resolves when the extended field is retrieved.

`key` is generated when the label is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

params.name: labelKeys
params.doc:
List of label keys to add to the contact.

<!--ONLY:REST
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[Find or Create Label](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/find-or-create-label)
or
[List Labels](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/list-labels).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[`findOrCreateLabel()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/findorcreatelabel)
or
[`queryLabels()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/querylabels).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

description: that resolves when the specified labels are added to the contact.

ret.doc: A `ContactsQueryBuilder` object that contains the refined query.

docs.summary: <!--ONLY:VELO--> Creates a query to retrieve a list of contacts. <!--END:ONLY:VELO-->
description: Retrieves a list of contacts, given the provided paging, filtering, and sorting.
Up to 1,000 contacts can be returned per request.
To learn how to query contacts, see
For a detailed list of supported filters and sorting options, see
The `queryContacts()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of contacts and returns a
The returned object contains the query definition,
which is typically used to run the query using the
by chaining `ContactsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query.
`ContactsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter,
The functions that are chained to `queryContacts()`
are applied in the order they are called.
the results are sorted first by the company name, and then —
if there are multiple results with the same company —
the items are sorted by last name.
#### Supported Query Filters for Contact Properties
For a full description of the `Contact` object, see
#### Supported Query Filters for Extended Fields
allow apps to add to the available data in the Contact List.
In addition to the default fields,
some Wix apps manage their own extended fields.
> When working directly with the `Contact` object in your code,
> data in extended fields must be accessed
> extended field names are flattened with dot notation, like this:

| Extended Field                                                | Supported Filters & Sorting                                                                                                                                                                              | Supported Values                                                       |
#### Supported Query Filters for Custom Fields
Extended fields created by 3rd-party apps and site contributors
You can add, remove, and change custom field names
All custom fields use the `custom` namespace.

extra.description:
You can use `queryContacts()`
to find a contact with specified details, and then extract the contact's ID.
With the contact ID, you can use [`emailContact()`](wix-crm-backend/emailcontact)
to send a triggered email.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field data is available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.notes",
the value can be accessed at `extendedFields["custom.notes"]`.

`key` is generated when the extended field is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

Fields that are included in `fieldMask.paths` are updated,
while all other fields are ignored.
- **To update a field:** Include the new value in `info`, and list the field in `fieldMask.paths`.
- **To clear a field:** List the field in `fieldMask.paths` only. Don't provide a value in `contactInfo`.
The `updateContact()` function returns a Promise that resolves
when the specified contact's information is updated.

members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.doc: Street address object, with number and name in separate fields.

members.name: formatted
members.doc:
Human-readable address string.
 If not provided, the value is generated from the available address data.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc:
Free text providing more detailed address information,
 such as apartment, suite, or floor.

members.name: location
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc:
Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in an
 [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: country
members.doc:
2-letter country code in an
 [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address's longitude.

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc: When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the contact is updated.
 To prevent conflicting changes,
 the existing `revision` must be used when updating a contact.

members.name: source
members.doc: Details about the contact's source.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the contact was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the contact was last updated.

members.name: lastActivity
members.doc: Details about the contact's last action in the site.

members.name: primaryInfo
members.doc: Contact's primary phone and email.

members.name: info
members.doc: Contact's details.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: ID of the contact that was found or created.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Identity type of the returned contact.

<!--ONLY:REST
- `CONTACT`: The returned contact ID belongs to a new or existing contact.
- `MEMBER`: The returned contact ID belongs to the currently logged-in site member.
- `NOT_AUTHENTICATED_MEMBER`: The returned contact ID belongs to a site member who is not currently logged in.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
One of:

- `"CONTACT"`: The returned contact ID belongs to a new or existing contact.
- `"MEMBER"`: The returned contact ID belongs to the currently logged-in site member.
- `"NOT_AUTHENTICATED_MEMBER"`: The returned contact ID belongs to a site member who is not currently logged in.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

description: To reconcile with an existing contact,
a phone or email must be provided,
or the current session identity must be attached to a contact or member.
If no existing contact can be found,
a new contact is created with the specified information.
Required if there's no contextual identity or given `contactId`.

members.name: name
members.doc: Contact's first and last name.

members.name: company
members.doc: Contact's company name.

members.name: jobTitle
members.doc:
Contact's job title.
 Corresponds to the **Position** field in the Dashboard.

members.name: locale
members.doc:
Contact's locale, formatted as an
 [IETF BCP 47 language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646).
 Typically, this is a lowercase 2-letter language code,
 followed by a hyphen,
 followed by an uppercase 2-letter country code.

 For example, German from Germany is formatted as `de-DE`,
 and U.S. English is formatted as `en-US`.

members.name: birthdate
members.doc:
Contact's birthdate, formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.

 Example: `"2020-03-15"` for March 15, 2020.

members.name: picture
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `profilePicture` instead.

members.name: emails
members.doc: List of up to 50 email addresses.

members.name: phones
members.doc: List of up to 50 phone numbers.

members.name: addresses
members.doc: List of up to 50 addresses.

members.name: labelKeys
members.doc:
List of contact label keys.
[Contact labels](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-labels-to-contacts-in-your-contact-list)
help categorize contacts.

<!--ONLY:REST
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[Find or Create Label](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/find-or-create-label)
or
[List Labels](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/list-labels)
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[`findOrCreateLabel()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/findorcreatelabel)
or
[`queryLabels()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/queryLabels).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
<!--ONLY:REST
Contact's extended fields,
where each key is the field key,
and each value is the field's value for the contact.

To view and manage extended fields, use the
[Extended Fields API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Contact's
[extended fields](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/introduction#about-extended-fields),
which allow you to store additional information about your contacts.

To view or create extended fields, use
[`findOrCreateExtendedField()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/findorcreateextendedfield),
[`getExtendedField()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/getextendedfield), or
[`queryExtendedFields()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/queryextendedfields).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: profilePicture
members.doc: Contact's profile picture URL.

members.name: image
members.doc: Image source. Can be either a Media Manager URL or external URL.

members.name: imageProvider
members.doc:
Indicates whether the image is retrieved from Wix Media
or an external provider.

<!--ONLY:REST
- `EXTERNAL`: The image is retrieved from an external provider.
- `WIX_MEDIA`: The image is retrieved from Wix Media.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
One of:

- `"EXTERNAL"`: The image is retrieved from an external provider.
- `"WIX_MEDIA"`: The image is retrieved from Wix Media.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

docs.summary: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field data is available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.notes",
the value can be accessed at `extendedFields["custom.notes"]`.

`key` is generated when the extended field is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Human-readable name shown in the Contact List.

members.name: dataType
members.doc:
Type of data the field holds.

<!--ONLY:REST
- `TEXT`: Accepts strings.
- `URL`: Accepts strings.
- `DATE`: Accepts dates formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `NUMBER`: Accepts integers. For decimals, use type `TEXT`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
One of:

- `"TEXT"`: Accepts strings.
- `"URL"`: Accepts strings.
- `"DATE"`: Accepts dates formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.
- `"NUMBER"`: Accepts integers. For decimals, use type `"TEXT"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: fieldType
members.doc:
<!--ONLY:REST
Indicates whether the extended field is a system field or custom field.

- `SYSTEM`: The field is a system field managed by Wix. System fields cannot be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.
- `USER_DEFINED`: The field is a custom field and can be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Indicates whether the extended field is a
[system field or custom field](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/introduction#about-extended-fields).

One of:

- `"SYSTEM"`: The field is a system field managed by Wix. System fields cannot be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.
- `"USER_DEFINED"`: The field is a custom field and can be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the field was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the field was last updated.

<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

Extended fields created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps
are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

 [IETF BCP 47 language tag](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646).
 Typically, this is a lowercase 2-letter language code,
 followed by a hyphen,
 followed by an uppercase 2-letter country code.

 For example, German from Germany is formatted as `de-DE`,
 and U.S. English is formatted as `en-US`.

members.name: birthdate
members.doc:
Contact's birthdate, formatted as `"YYYY-MM-DD"`.

 Example: `"2020-03-15"` for March 15, 2020.

members.name: picture
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `profilePicture` instead.

members.name: emails
members.doc: List of up to 50 email addresses.

members.name: phones
members.doc: List of up to 50 phone numbers.

members.name: addresses
members.doc: List of up to 50 addresses.

members.name: labelKeys
members.doc:
List of contact label keys.
[Contact labels](https://support.wix.com/en/article/adding-labels-to-contacts-in-your-contact-list)
help categorize contacts.

<!--ONLY:REST
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[Find or Create Label](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/find-or-create-label)
or
[List Labels](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/list-labels)
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Label keys must exist to be added to the contact.
Contact labels can be created or retrieved with
[`findOrCreateLabel()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/findorcreatelabel)
or
[`queryLabels()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/queryLabels).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs.
<!--ONLY:REST
Contact's extended fields,
where each key is the field key,
and each value is the field's value for the contact.

To view and manage extended fields, use the
[Extended Fields API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Contact's
[extended fields](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/introduction#about-extended-fields),
which allow you to store additional information about your contacts.

To view or create extended fields, use
[`findOrCreateExtendedField()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/findorcreateextendedfield),
[`getExtendedField()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/getextendedfield), or
[`queryExtendedFields()`](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/queryextendedfields).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: profilePicture
members.doc: Contact's profile picture URL.

docs.summary: Label that was found or created.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Label key.

`key` is generated when the label is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Human-readable label name shown in the Dashboard.

members.name: labelType
members.doc:
Label type.

<!--ONLY:REST
- `SYSTEM`: The label is a default system label for the Contact List.
- `USER_DEFINED`: The label was created by a site contributor or 3rd-party app.
- `WIX_APP_DEFINED`: The label was created by a Wix app.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
One of:

- `"SYSTEM"`: The label is a predefined system label for the Contact List.
- `"USER_DEFINED"`: The label was created by a site contributor or app.
- `"WIX_APP_DEFINED"`: The label was created by a Wix app.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the label was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the label was last updated.

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
<!--ONLY:REST
Label namespace.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Label [namespace](wix-crm-backend/contacts-obj/introduction#the-namespace-and-key-properties-in-labels-and-extended-fields).
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

Labels created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps
are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

members.name: items
members.doc: List of labels.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

docs.summary: Details about the contact's last action in the site.

members.name: activityDate
members.doc: Date and time of the last action.

members.name: activityType
members.doc:
Contact's last action in the site.

<!--ONLY:REST
For descriptions of each value, see
[Last Activity Types](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/last-activity-types).
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Some possible values:
`"GENERAL"`, `"CONTACT_CREATED"`, `"MEMBER_LOGIN"`, `"MEMBER_REGISTER"`,
`"MEMBER_STATUS_CHANGED"`, `"FORM_SUBMITTED"`, `"INBOX_FORM_SUBMITTED"`,
`"INBOX_PAYMENT_REQUEST_PAID"`, `"INBOX_MESSAGE_TO_CUSTOMER"`,
`"INBOX_MESSAGE_FROM_CUSTOMER"`, `"NEWSLETTER_SUBSCRIPTION_FORM_SUBMITTED"`,
`"NEWSLETTER_SUBSCRIPTION_UNSUBSCRIBE"`, `"ECOM_PURCHASE"`,
`"ECOM_CART_ABANDON"`, `"ECOM_CHECKOUT_BUYER"`, `"BOOKINGS_APPOINTMENT"`,
`"HOTELS_RESERVATION"`, `"HOTELS_PURCHASE"`, `"HOTELS_CONFIRMATION"`,
`"HOTELS_CANCEL"`, `"VIDEO_PURCHASE"`, `"VIDEO_RENT"`,
`"CASHIER_BUTTON_PURCHASE"`, `"ARENA_NEW_LEAD"`, `"EVENTS_RSVP"`,
`"INVOICE_PAY"`, `"INVOICE_OVERDUE"`, `"PRICE_QUOTE_ACCEPT"`,
`"PRICE_QUOTE_EXPIRE"`, `"RESTAURANTS_ORDER"`, `"RESTAURANTS_RESERVATION"`,
`"SHOUTOUT_OPEN"`, `"SHOUTOUT_CLICK"`, `"CONTACT_MERGED"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `100`.

members.name: skip
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options.

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc: When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation. Defaults to `false`.

members.name: first
members.doc: Contact's first name.

members.name: last
members.doc: Contact's last name.

members.name: allowDuplicates
members.doc:
Controls whether the call will succeed
if the new contact information contains an email already used by another contact.

If set to `true`,
the call will succeed even if an email address is used by another contact.
If set to `false`,
the call will fail if an email address is used by another contact.

Defaults to `false`.

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc: When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation. Defaults to `false`.

docs.summary: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: length
members.doc: Number of items returned.

members.name: totalCount
members.doc: Number of items that matched the query.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc:
Indicates if `total` calculation timed out before the response was sent.
 Typically this happens if there is a large set of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Phone ID.

members.name: tag
members.doc:
Phone type.

<!--ONLY:REST
`UNTAGGED` is shown as "Other" in the Contact List.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
`"UNTAGGED"` is shown as "Other" in the Contact List.

One of:

- `"UNTAGGED"`
- `"MAIN"`
- `"HOME"`
- `"MOBILE"`
- `"WORK"`
- `"FAX"`
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: countryCode
members.doc: [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: e164Phone
members.doc:
[ITU E.164-formatted](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/)
 phone number.
 Automatically generated using `phone` and `countryCode`,
 as long as both of those values are valid.

members.name: primary
members.doc:
Whether this is the contact's primary phone number.
 When changing `primary` to `true` for a phone,
 the contact's other phones become `false`.

members.name: tag
members.doc:
Phone type.

<!--ONLY:REST
`UNTAGGED` is shown as "Other" in the Contact List.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
`"UNTAGGED"` is shown as "Other" in the Contact List.

One of:

- `"UNTAGGED"`
- `"MAIN"`
- `"HOME"`
- `"MOBILE"`
- `"WORK"`
- `"FAX"`
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: countryCode
members.doc: [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) country code.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: primary
members.doc:
Whether this is the contact's primary phone number.
 When changing `primary` to `true` for a phone,
 the contact's other phones become `false`.

members.name: image
members.doc: Deprecated. Use `profilePicture` instead.

members.name: imageProvider
members.doc: Deprecated.

members.name: email
members.doc:
Primary email address.

<!--ONLY:REST
This property reflects the email address in `info.emails`
where `primary` is `true`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
This property reflects the email address in `contactInfo.emails`
where `primary` is `true`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: phone
members.doc:
Primary phone number.

<!--ONLY:REST
This property reflects the phone number in `info.phones`
where `primary` is `true`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
This property reflects the phone number in `contactInfo.phones`
where `primary` is `true`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

docs.summary: The `options` parameter is an optional parameter that can be used when calling the query [`find()`](#find) function.

members.name: search
members.doc:
Plain text search for an exact match, up to 100 characters.

Searchable fields:

- `info.name.first`
- `info.name.last`
- `info.emails.email`
- `info.phones.phone`

members.name: suppressAuth
members.doc:
When `true`, prevents permission checks from running for the operation.

Defaults to `false`.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order.

<!--ONLY:REST
- `ASC`: Ascending order
- `DESC`: Descending order.

Defaults to `ASC`.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
One of:

- `"ASC"`: Ascending order
- `"DESC"`: Descending order

Defaults to `"ASC"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: sourceType
members.doc:
Source type.

<!--ONLY:VELO-->
Some possible values:
`"OTHER"`, `"ADMIN"`, `"WIX_APP"`, `"IMPORT"`, `"THIRD_PARTY"`,
`"WIX_BOOKINGS"`, `"WIX_CHAT"`, `"WIX_EMAIL_MARKETING"`, `"WIX_EVENTS"`,
`"WIX_FORMS"`, `"WIX_GROUPS"`, `"WIX_HOTELS"`, `"WIX_MARKET_PLACE"`,
`"WIX_MUSIC"`, `"WIX_RESTAURANTS"`, `"WIX_SITE_MEMBERS"`, `"WIX_STORES"`.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: appId
members.doc: App ID, if the contact was created by an app.

docs.summary: Street address object, with number and name in separate fields.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

docs.summary: Street address object, with number and name in separate fields.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.
